info.title: University of Bergen Library - Cultural heritage collections API
info.description: The University of Bergen Library's API are a work-in-progress. It aims to provide JSON-formatted data as a REST-style service that allows developers to explore and integrate the library’s public data into their projects. This API is the same tool that will power our website and many other technologies in the library.

contact.name: Digital development at the University of Bergen Library

tags.name: Collections
tags.description: WIP. Collections are used to group manifests together. They can be used to group manifests by theme, by time period, by location, or any other criteria.

get.summary: A single object metadata JSON or a IIIF manifest by identifier.
get.description: This resource represents an object in the collection, with the option to as for IIIF or RDF. Each object is identified by a string `id`. `id` is the identifier from our collections management system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the manifest to retrieve

parameters.name: as
parameters.description: The data domain model to use. Supports 'iiif' and 'rdf'.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The data format to use. Supports `json` (default), `turtle` and `xml`. Ignored if `as=iiif`.

get.summary: A single object IIIF manifest by the given identifier.
get.description: OBS! The prefered way of getting a manifest is to use the `/items/{id}?as=iiif`. {id} is the identifier from our collections management system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the manifest to retrieve

post.description: This will delete the index, recreate it, add pipelines and mappings. This is a destructive operation.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The name of the index to prepare

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to retrieve

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the actor to retrieve

get.summary: A single link redirect with all metadata

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path slug to look up.

get.summary: Resolve an id and get the service that it belongs to.

en.example: The picture is taken on a journey to the Middle East, where UN-photographer Jørgen Grinde documentet UN-operations such as UNEF, UNRWA and UNTSO

no.example: Bildet er tatt på en reise i Midtøsten 1956/57, hvor FN-fotograf Jørgen Grinde dokumenterte forskjellige FN-operasjoner som UNEF, UNRWA og UNTSO.

ManifestSuccess.description: Request for a manifest was successful

CollectionSearchSuccess.description: Request for a collection was successful

HumanMadeObjectSuccess.description: Request for an item was successful

EventSuccess.description: Request for a event was successful

ActorSuccess.description: Request for an actor was successful

LinkSuccess.description: Request for a link was successful

ResolverSuccess.description: Request to resolve an id was successful
